segment.source: Checklist Configuring Rules for the Boundary Zone (Windows 10)
segment.target: Checklist Configuring Rules for the Boundary Zone (Windows 10)

segment.source: Checklist Configuring Rules for the Boundary Zone
segment.target: Checklist Configuring Rules for the Boundary Zone

segment.source: Checklist: Configuring Rules for the Boundary Zone
segment.target: Checklist: Configuring Rules for the Boundary Zone

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: The following checklists include tasks for configuring connection security rules and IPsec settings in your GPOs to implement the boundary zone in an isolated domain.
segment.target: The following checklists include tasks for configuring connection security rules and IPsec settings in your GPOs to implement the boundary zone in an isolated domain.

segment.source: Rules for the boundary zone are typically the same as those for the isolated domain, with the exception that the final rule is left to only request, not require, authentication.
segment.target: Rules for the boundary zone are typically the same as those for the isolated domain, with the exception that the final rule is left to only request, not require, authentication.

segment.source: Checklist: Configuring boundary zone rules
segment.target: Checklist: Configuring boundary zone rules

segment.source: This checklist assumes that you have already created the GPO for the isolated domain as described in Checklist: Implementing a Domain Isolation Policy Design.
segment.target: This checklist assumes that you have already created the GPO for the isolated domain as described in Checklist: Implementing a Domain Isolation Policy Design.

segment.source: After you create a copy for the boundary zone, make sure that you do not change the rule from request authentication to require authentication when you create the other GPOs.
segment.target: After you create a copy for the boundary zone, make sure that you do not change the rule from request authentication to require authentication when you create the other GPOs.

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: Make a copy of the domain isolation GPO for this version of Windows to serve as a starting point for the GPO for the boundary zone.
segment.target: Make a copy of the domain isolation GPO for this version of Windows to serve as a starting point for the GPO for the boundary zone.

segment.source: Unlike the GPO for the main isolated domain zone, this copy is not changed after deployment to require authentication.
segment.target: Unlike the GPO for the main isolated domain zone, this copy is not changed after deployment to require authentication.

segment.source: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO
segment.target: Copy a GPO to Create a New GPO

segment.source: If you are working on a copy of a GPO, modify the group memberships and WMI filters so that they are correct for the boundary zone and version of Windows for which this GPO is intended.
segment.target: If you are working on a copy of a GPO, modify the group memberships and WMI filters so that they are correct for the boundary zone and version of Windows for which this GPO is intended.

segment.source: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows
segment.target: Modify GPO Filters to Apply to a Different Zone or Version of Windows

segment.source: Link the GPO to the domain level of the Active Directory organizational unit hierarchy.
segment.target: Link the GPO to the domain level of the Active Directory organizational unit hierarchy.

segment.source: Link the GPO to the Domain
segment.target: Link the GPO to the Domain

segment.source: Add your test computers to the membership group for the boundary zone.
segment.target: Add your test computers to the membership group for the boundary zone.

segment.source: Be sure to add at least one for each operating system supported by a different GPO in the group.
segment.target: Be sure to add at least one for each operating system supported by a different GPO in the group.

segment.source: Add Test Computers to the Membership Group for a Zone
segment.target: Add Test Computers to the Membership Group for a Zone

segment.source: Verify that the connection security configuration is protecting network traffic with authentication when it can, and that unauthenticated traffic is accepted.
segment.target: Verify that the connection security configuration is protecting network traffic with authentication when it can, and that unauthenticated traffic is accepted.

segment.source: Verify That Network Traffic Is Authenticated
segment.target: Verify That Network Traffic Is Authenticated
